Article.Abstract: CD8 T cells drive the protective immune response to lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus (LCMV) infection and are thus a determining force in the selection of viral variants. To examine how escape mutations affect the presentation and recognition of overlapping T-cell epitopes, we isolated an LCMV variant that is not recognized by T-cell receptor (TCR)-transgenic H-2Db-restricted LCMV GP33-41-specific cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTL). The variant virus carried a single-amino-acid substitution (valine to alanine) at position 35 of the viral glycoprotein. This region of the LCMV glycoprotein encodes both the Db-restricted GP33-43 epitope and a second epitope (GP34-42) presented by the Kb molecule. We determined that the V-to-A CTL escape mutant failed to induce a Db GP33-43-specific CTL response and that Db-restricted GP33-43-specific CTL induced by the wild-type LCMV strain were unable to kill target cells infected with the variant LCMV strain. In contrast, the Kb-restricted response was much less affected. We found that the V-to-A substitution severely impaired peptide binding to Db but not to Kb molecules. Strikingly, the V-to-A mutation did not change any of the anchor residues, and the dramatic effect on binding was therefore unexpected. The strong decrease in Db binding explains why the variant virus escapes the Db GP33-43-specific response but still elicits the Kb-restricted response. These findings also illustrate that mutations within regions encoding overlapping T-cell epitopes can differentially affect the presentation and recognition of individual epitopes.
Article.ArticleTitle: In vivo selection of a lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus variant that affects recognition of the GP33-43 epitope by H-2Db but not H-2Kb.
Article.Affiliations: Emory Vaccine Center and Department of Microbiology and Immunology, Emory University School of Medicine, Atlanta, Georgia 30322, USA.

Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Substitution; Animals; Antigens, Viral; CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Flow Cytometry; Glycoproteins(immunology); H-2 Antigens(genetics; immunology); Histocompatibility Antigen H-2D; Interferon-gamma(analysis); Lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus(immunology); Major Histocompatibility Complex(immunology); Mice; Mice, Knockout; Mice, Transgenic; Mutation; Peptide Fragments(genetics; immunology); Spleen(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Viral Proteins

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Responses seen towards the epitope is similar in B6 and Kb-/- mice infected with WT virus, while recognition of this epitope is severely impaired in variant virus infected mice (obtained from an escape mutant, where epitope sequence has a V3A substitution, isolated from P14 mice), particularly in Kb-/- mice, suggesting that the Db restricted responses are affected by the V3A mutation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunogen is either WT LCMV or escape mutant strain, isolated from previously infected P14 mice, that was shown to include V35A mutation in epitope sequence. Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Responses towards the epitope is diminished in mice infected with a variant virus (obtained from an escape mutant isolated from P14 mice) than in mice infected with the WT virus. This is confirmed by tetramer staining of the CD8 cells, where variant infected mice are only capable of recognizing Kb (GP34-41) tetramers, since recognition of GP33-41 in a Db context is completely abrogated.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Responses seen towards the epitope is similar in B6 and Db-/- mice infected with WT virus, while recognition of this epitope is severely impaired in variant virus (obtained from an escape mutant isolated from P14 mice, where epitope sequence has a V3A substitution,) infected B6 mice, but not in Db-/- mice, suggesting that the Kb restricted responses are not affected by the VA3 mutation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-specific TCR transgenic mice were infected with wild type virus (which is not controlled in these Tg mice). Their splenocytes are able to lyse WT virus-infected target cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A 19% of the CD8+ cells from mice infected with WT virus respond to WT epitope, while 3.1% responding CD8+ cells are seen in mice infected with escape mutant virus (harboring V35A mutation in epitope sequence). The comparative results with the response towards the mutant epitope, and with Db restricted epitope specific TCR Tg mice, suggested that this mutation affects MHC-I Db binding, while the response seen in WT mice corresponds to a Kb restricted response to the overlapping epitope GP34-41. This was confirmed by tetramer staining (either with Kb- or Db-peptides) of these cells, showing that the epitope specific cells seen in WT virus infected mice are both Db (GP33-41) and Kb (GP34-41) restricted, while variant virus infected mice responses are Kb (GP34-41) restricted.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Native epitope sequence in all databases has a C in position 9. Artificial peptide with M at position 9 is used in MHC binding analysis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The presence of the methionine residue at the C-terminalanchor position stabilized the peptide class I interaction for Db in relation to native sequence (IC50 5420 nM).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: An escape mutant encoding the V3A substitution was obtained and the variant peptide is studied for MHC binding. Native epitope sequence in all databases has a C in position 9. Artificial peptide with M at position 9 is used in this MHC binding assay.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The presence of the methionine residue at the C-terminalanchor position stabilized the peptide class I interaction for Db(IC50 5 21 nM, Table 1). Consistent with this, the V3A variant 9-mer peptide had an IC50 of 329 nM, which suggests that thispeptide should still bind Db.
The effect of the V3A substitution on Kb binding (from 7 to 20 nM IC50) is much less dramatic than the effect on Db binding (from 21 to 329 nM IC50).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: An escape mutant encoding the V3A substitution was obtained from Tg mice infected with LCMV virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection. Immunogen is the escape mutant virus that harbor this epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Low response (3%) of the peptide-specific TCR transgenic CD8+ cells from mice infected with V35A escape mutant virus respond to escape mutant epitope, while a strong response is seen from mice infected with WT virus, suggesting that this mutation affects MHC-I binding or processing, but not Tg TCR recognition.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection. Immunogen is either the escape mutant that harbor this epitope or the WT virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: B6 Kb-/- mice infected with V35A escape mutant respond to escape mutant epitope poorly, while a higher response is seen in WT virus infected animals, showing that the recognition of this mutant epitope is dependent on Kb. Since priming with the Wt virus can partially overcome the lack of response, MHC processing or binding is affected , but not TCR recognition.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A 25% of the peptide-specific TCR transgenic CD8+ cells from mice infected with WT virus respond to V35A escape mutant epitope, while no response is seen from mice infected with the escape mutant virus, suggesting that this mutation affects MHC-I binding or processing, but not Tg TCR recognition.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection. Immunogen is either the escape mutant that harbor this epitope or the WT virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: B6 mice infected with V35A escape mutant or with WT virus respond to escape mutant epitope similarly, showing that the recognition of this mutant epitope can be obtained in normal mice. The comparative results with the response towards the WT epitope, and with Db restricted epitope specific TCR Tg mice, suggested that this mutation affects MHC-I Db binding, while the response seen in WT mice corresponds to a Kb restricted response to the overlapping epitope GP34-41. This was confirmed by tetramer staining (either with Kb- or Db-peptides) of these cells, showing that the epitope specific cells seen in WT virus infected mice are both Db (GP33-41) and Kb (GP34-41) restricted, while mutant virus infected mice responses are Kb (GP34-41) restricted.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection. Immunogen is either the escape mutant that harbor this epitope or the WT virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-specific TCR transgenic mice were infected with WT or escape mutant (previously isolated from these mice, with V35A mutation in epitope sequence) virus. Their splenocytes fail to lyse mutant-virus-infected cells (and in the case of mutant-virus-infected animals, they also fail to lyse WT infected cells), consistent with the hypothesis that the mutation affects MHC-I binding, processing and/or TCR recognition.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection. Immunogen is the escape mutant virus that harbor this epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: B6 Db-/- mice infected with V35A escape mutant respond to escape mutant epitope similarly that WT virus infected animals to WT peptide, showing that the recognition of this mutant epitope is independent on Db. This is confirmed by peptide MHC tetramer analysis in normal B6 mice, showing that V3A epitope is recognized by Kb but not Db restricted cells.
The effect of the V3A substitution on Kb binding (from 22 to 49 nM IC50) is much less dramatic than the effect on Db binding (from 395 to 17089 nM IC50).
The V3A substitution had a dramatic effect on the Db binding affinity of the peptide: the IC50 value changed from 395 nM for the wild-type peptide to 17,089 nM for the variant peptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-specific TCR transgenic mice were infected with wild type virus (which is not controlled in these Tg mice). Their splenocytes are able to lyse WT virus-infected target cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunogen is either WT LCMV or escape mutant strain, isolated from previously infected P14 mice, that was shown to include V35A mutation in epitope sequence. Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A 7.8% of the CD8+ cells from mice infected with WT virus respond to escape mutant epitope, while 7.4% responding CD8+ cells are seen in mice infected with escape mutant virus (harboring V35A mutation in epitope sequence). The comparative results with the response towards the WT epitope, and with Db restricted epitope specific TCR Tg mice, suggested that this mutation affects MHC-I Db binding, while the response seen in WT mice corresponds to a Kb restricted response to the overlapping epitope GP34-41. This was confirmed by tetramer staining (either with Kb- or Db-peptides) of these cells, showing that the epitope specific cells seen in variant virus infected mice are Kb restricted.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunogen is either WT LCMV or escape mutant strain, isolated from previously infected P14 mice, that was shown to include V35A mutation in epitope sequence. Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Responses seen towards the WT or escape mutant (V35A) epitopic sequences (~20% and ~7%, respectively) are similar in WT and Kb-/- mice infected with WT virus, while responses to this epitopes are diminished in Kb-/- mice infected with escape mutant virus (harboring the V35A mutation), suggesting that the Db restricted responses are severely affected by the VA3 mutation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunogen is either WT LCMV or escape mutant strain, isolated from previously infected P14 mice, that was shown to include V35A mutation in epitope sequence. Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Responses seen towards the escape mutant (V35A) epitopic sequence is similar in WT and Db-/- mice infected with WT virus, while responses to the variant epitope are enhanced in Db-/- mice infected with escape mutant virus (harboring the V35A mutation), suggesting that the Kb restricted responses are not affected by the VA3 mutation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunogen is either WT LCMV or escape mutant strain, isolated from previously infected P14 mice, that was shown to include V35A mutation in epitope sequence. Mice were sacrificed 8 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A 25% of the peptide-specific TCR transgenic CD8+ cells from mice infected with WT virus respond to V35A escape mutant epitope, while no response is seen from Tg mice infected with the escape mutant virus, suggesting that this mutation affects MHC-I binding or processing, but not Tg TCR recognition.
